Dear Ms. Skinner:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (517) 899 - 6024.

Sincerely,
Barbara A Cote, Licensing Consultant

Rule Code Sufficiency of staff.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 12/01/24, a youth was assaulted by two other youth at the
facility.
Investigation Complainant was interviewed via telephone on December 2,
2024, and reported no further information.
2

Youth A was interviewed via telephone on December 4, 2024,
in collaboration with DHHS Worker who was at the facility.
Youth A described being in a fight with Youth B and Youth C in the
early morning of 12/01/24. Youth A reported Staff 2, Staff 3, Staff
7, Staff 9 and Supervisor 2 were present during the fight. Youth A
described getting up around 6am and turning the lights on. Youth
A stated Youth B and Youth C were yelling at Youth A because
there was still an hour left to sleep. Youth A reported Staff 7
asked Youth A to go in her P aisle (personal aisle) until it was time
for everyone to wake up. Youth A stated Youth B threw a
shampoo bottle at Youth A and Youth C got out of bed and came
into Youth A’s P aisle and started ripping up Youth A’s stuff.
Youth A reported she went to Youth C’s P aisle and knocked over
the dresser. Youth A stated Youth C started to fight Youth A and
Youth B joined Youth C in the fight. Youth A described fighting
back against Youth B and Youth C. Youth A reported she was
trying to move away but staff would not let her. Youth A stated
her shirt was ripped off and her tooth that is already chipped cut
her lip during the fight.
Youth A reported she could not recall what staff were doing during
the fight because she was getting jumped by Youth B and Youth
C. Youth A denied any youth was placed in a restraint. Youth A
described the fight lasting “a good minute.” Youth A reported staff
did not try to get between Youth A, Youth B or Youth C during the
fight. Youth A stated the fight ended when Youth B and Youth C
left the unit with Staff 2 because Youth A had fallen to the ground.
Youth A reported she was punched in the mouth, was spitting up
blood, got kicked in the stomach by Youth C and had her braids
pulled.
Youth B was interviewed via telephone on December 4, 2024,
in collaboration with DHHS Worker who was at the facility.
Youth B described a fight occurring between Youth A, Youth B
and Youth C around 6am because Youth A was saying she was
going to smack Youth B and Youth C. Youth B stated Youth A got
beat up and was bleeding but that was “her [Youth A] fault.”
Youth B reported staff were “trying to do their job.” Youth B could
not recall what staff were working when the fight occurred. Youth
B described staff doing the best they could to break up the fight.
Youth B could not recall how long the fight lasted. Youth B stated
the fight ended when Youth A “got stomped and we [Youth B and
Youth C] walked out of the unit to get water.” Youth B reported
staff always try and stop fights by standing between the youth or
pulling the youth apart.
3

Youth C was interviewed via telephone on December 4, 2024,
in collaboration with DHHS Worker who was at the facility.
Youth C described getting into a fight with Youth A on 12/01/24
about 6am because Youth A turned on the lights and was being
“petty.” Youth C reported Youth A said she was going to “slap
these girls [Youth B and Youth C]” and Youth C took that as a
threat. Youth C described Youth A throwing shampoo bottles at
Youth B, coming into Youth C’s P aisle trying to mess it up and
that is when the fight started. Youth C described Youth B
punching Youth A, but staff were able to get Youth B and Youth A
apart, stopping the fight. Youth C stated Staff 2, Staff 7, and Staff
9 were trying to break up the fight. Youth B reported Staff 7 was
trying to get Youth A to calm down and go back to bed when
Youth A first started turning on the lights and saying things to
Youth B and Youth C.
Youth C reported staff were telling Youth B and Youth C to “come
on” and Youth A kept swinging at Youth C during this time. Youth
C stated she recalled a staff pulling Youth A off Youth C but did
not know what staff intervened. Youth C denied any of the youth
being placed in a restraint. Youth C described staff standing and
watching the fight during different times without intervening.
Youth C described the fight ending when Youth B and Youth C left
the unit and went to the cafeteria with Staff 7.
Youth D was interviewed via telephone on December 4, 2024,
in collaboration with DHHS Worker who was at the facility.
Youth D described Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C getting into a
fight on 12/1/2024. Youth D reported the only staff trying to break
up the fight was Staff 9 because Staff 7 fell on the floor and hurt
her knee and could not stand up. Youth D stated Staff 2 and
Supervisor 2 were the other staff in the unit. Youth D reported she
did not see a lot of the fight from her P aisle so is not sure what
staff did or did not due to stop the fight. Youth D stated she does
not believe any youth were restrained during the fight.
Youth F was interviewed via telephone on December 4, 2024,
in collaboration with DHHS Worker who was at the facility.
Youth F reported Youth A was “jumped” by Youth B and Youth C
in the unit “one day last week.” Youth F stated Staff 2, Staff 3,
Staff 7, Staff 9 and Supervisor 2 were in the unit during the fight.
Youth F reported staff were trying to prevent the fight by standing
between all three youth, having their hands/arms out and trying to
block all three youth from landing punches. Youth F described
staff trying to restrain one of the youths but there were not enough
staff to restrain and keep the other two youth from fighting. Youth
4

F reported toward the end of the fight it looked like staff were not
trying to stop the fight because Youth A’s shirt was pulled off by
Youth C. Youth F described Youth A being topless so Staff 9
(male staff) walked away and would not touch Youth A. Youth F
stated Staff 2 was trying to stop Youth C from kicking Youth A
during this time. Youth F reported the fight ended when Youth B
and Youth C left the unit with Staff 3.
Staff 7 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
December 10, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff
7 described the argument between Youth A, Youth B, and Youth
C starting around 6:30am over Youth A turning the lights on. Staff
7 reported she redirected Youth A and told Youth B and Youth C
to let Staff 7 handle the situation. Staff 7 reported the situation
escalated and Youth C and Youth A started fighting. Staff 7
stated she was using proximity with Youth B trying to keep Youth
B out of the fight. Staff 7 described Supervisor 2, Staff 3 and Staff
9 were trying to separate Youth A and Youth C from fighting. Staff
7 reported she fell on her knees and was unable to get up. Staff 7
described Staff 2 coming over to try and keep Youth B away from
Youth A as Staff 7 was on the floor. Staff 7 denied at any time
staff letting the youths fight or not trying to intervene to stop the
fighting. Staff 7 described Staff 2 and Staff 9 getting in-between
the youth, using their bodies to block the punches, and using the
hand release technique as one of the youths had one of the other
youth’s hair. Staff 7 reported Supervisor 2 did not really do too
much to break up the fight but stated Supervisor 2 is on restriction
from being injured. Staff 7 stated the fight ended when Staff 2
was able to get Youth B and Youth C out of the unit. Staff 7
denied any youth being restrained during the fight. Staff 7 stated
during the entire time the youth were fighting staff were trying to
intervene.
Staff 2 was interviewed via telephone on December 13, 2024,
in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 2 described when
she arrived on shift 12/01/2024 Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C
were already fighting. Staff 2 reported she entered the unit,
dropped her bag and intervened the best she could by trying to
put her arm around one of the youths and move the youth back.
Staff 2 stated Staff 3, Staff 7, Staff 9 and Supervisor 2 were in the
unit trying to stop the fight. Staff 2 reported one staff fell on the
ground and was unable to get up. Staff 2 denied ever seeing a
time when staff were not trying to intervene or break up the fight.
Staff 2 described it all “happening so fast.” Staff 2 reported the
fight ended when the youth just stopped. Staff 2 stated staff were
intervening appropriately, using the correct training techniques,
5

and doing what they could to stop the fight. Staff 2 denied any
youth being restrained. Staff 2 stated youth were not restrained
because there was not enough staff to keep the other two youth
away from the youth that would have been restrained, allowing the
youth in the restraint to be assaulted.
Staff 9 was interviewed via telephone on December 13, 2024,
in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 9 described starting
his shift at 6am and soon after the fight started between Youth A,
Youth B, and Youth C. Staff 9 reported Staff 7 was trying to
deescalate Youth A, but Youth A would not calm down. Staff 9
reported Youth B pushed Staff 7 to the ground and that is when
“things ignited.” Staff 9 described Youth B running around Staff 7,
who was on the ground, and punching Youth A. Staff 9 described
trying to get in-between Youth A and Youth B, while Staff 3
attempted to keep Youth C away from Youth A and Youth B. Staff
9 reported once Staff 7 fell to the ground she was unable to stand
back up so could not do anything to help.
Staff 9 reported there were several times staff were not engaging.
Staff 9 described there was one time when Youth A and Youth B
were by the TV and “getting it on pretty good.” Staff 9 stated he
stepped away from the situation because Youth B ripped off Youth
A’s shirt and bra. Staff 9 reported when he stepped back staff
were not doing anything. Staff 9 described Youth A falling to the
ground, Youth C kicking Youth A and Youth A spitting up blood.
Staff 9 stated at that point he ran over to the situation, but the
damage was already done. Staff 9 denied seeing any staff pull
any of the youth back by the arms or pull Youth A back on the
ground away from Youth C.
Staff 9 denied any youth were placed in a restraint. Staff 9
reported there were enough staff to perform a restraint but the
youth that would have been restrained would have been assaulted
by the other youth. Staff 9 stated Staff 3 is a new staff and
handled the situation well, but just got overpowered by Youth C.
Staff 9 denied having any concerns with how staff intervened only
that he wished staff would have done more.
Staff 3 was interviewed on December 20, 2024, via telephone
in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 3 described being
new at the facility and not yet knowing all the staffs’ names. Staff
3 reported Staff 7 got in-between Youth A and Youth B when they
started arguing. Staff 3 stated she grabbed Youth C and then
ended up grabbing Youth A because Staff 3 has a closer
relationship with Youth A. Staff 3 described Staff 7 tripping and
6

falling to the ground and not being able to stand up to intervene
for the rest of the fight. Staff 3 denied any youth being restrained.
Staff 3 reported Staff 2, Staff 7, Staff 9 and Supervisor 2 were in
the unit trying to stop the fight. Staff 3 stated staff were trying to
intervene the whole time it was just hard to contain the youth
because they kept going after one another. Staff 3 denied ever
seeing staff stand back and allow the youths to fight. Staff 3
reported it was not handled in the way she thought it needed to be
or like Staff 3 was trained. Staff 3 stated the youths needed to be
separated and removed from the unit to deescalate the situation.
Staff 3 reported staff were pulling on the youths’ arms, not
aggressively, but trying to pull the youths back away from one
another. Staff 3 stated the fight finally ended when staff were able
to separate Youth B and Youth C from Youth A.
Video Reviewed
Video footage of 12/1/2024 was reviewed with DHHS Worker.
Video shows Staff 7 standing in front of Youth A who appears to
be saying something to someone behind Staff 7. Youth A is seen
throwing items and clapping while Staff 7 continues to stand in
front of Youth A. Supervisor 2 enters the unit and appears to be
talking to Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C. Youth B is seen leaving
her P aisle and quickly moves toward Youth A. Staff 7 moves to
get in front of Youth B and at the same time Youth C moves
toward Youth A and staff (cannot tell who in the video) move in
front of Youth C. Youth A is seen climbing on a table with Staff 9
standing in front of Youth A and the table. Youth B throws some
sort of liquid at Youth A as Youth A is dancing, clapping and
moving her arms around while standing on the table. It appears
staff are talking. Staff are moving back and forth to stay in front of
Youth B and Youth C blocking them from getting to Youth A on the
table. Youth A gets down from the table, moves quickly behind
Staff 9 and moves toward Youth B. Youth C and Youth B move
toward Youth A and begin punching one another. Staff are
attempting to get between the youth, Staff 7 falls to the ground
and remains on the ground for most of the fight. Video shows
staff following the youth around the unit, standing between the
youth and placing their arms out to create space. Staff 9 is seen
pulling Youth A back and away from Youth C who is kicking Youth
A while on the ground. Staff (cannot identify who) pulls Youth C
by the wrist attempting to move Youth C away from Youth A. The
video is 9 minutes and 41 seconds in length.
Documents Reviewed:
• DHHS Worker’s interview notes with Supervisor 2. I was
not able to be present for this interview and Supervisor 2
7

left on medical leave soon after DHHS Worker’s interview.
Supervisor 2 reported Staff 2, Staff 3, Staff 7, Staff 9, and
herself were in the unit when the fight occurred between
Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C. Supervisor 2 reported all
three youth and staff were getting hit. Supervisor 2 stated
staff were trying to break up the fight the entire time and
denied there was any point when staff were not trying to.
Supervisor 2 denied seeing any staff pull any of the youth
by their arms or pull a youth back when on the floor.
Supervisor 2 denied seeing any staff intervene in a way
they should not have or that was inappropriate.
• Wolverine Human Services Behavior Support and
Management Policy. Policy documents staff are to provide
immediate emotional and environmental support to clients
in crisis so that stress and the risk for violence are reduced.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as per staff and youth
interviews and video review the facility did not have a sufficient
number of staff in order to provide for the continual needs and
protection of the youth.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
It is recommended for the facility to review the video footage of
this incident and use as a training tool to help staff recognize if
one or two of the youth would have been removed from the unit at
the beginning of the situation, the situation might have
deescalated sooner than it did.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established

Rule Code Youth nutrition
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4149
Section (1) A licensee shall provide a minimum of 3 nutritious edible meals
Description daily unless medically contraindicated and documented.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
8

Allegation Youth was not fed throughout the day on 12/01/2024.
Investigation Youth A was interviewed via telephone on December 4, 2024,
in collaboration with DHHS Worker who was at the facility.
Youth A reported she did not eat lunch or dinner on December 1,
2024. Youth A denied eating lunch because it was a sack lunch,
and she does not like strawberries. Youth A stated she was given
a cold sandwich but could not eat it because her lip was cut open.
Youth A reported she did not eat dinner because no one told her
about dinner. Youth A later stated staff [did not know what staff]
tried to get Youth A to eat with the group but Youth A reported she
did not want to be around Youth B and Youth C.
Youth C was interviewed via telephone on December 4, 2024,
in collaboration with DHHS Worker who was at the facility.
Youth C described Youth A being in the group room for lunch and
dinner on December 1, 2024. Youth C reported she could see
Youth A through the glass into the group room and saw Youth A
eating both meals. Youth C was not sure if Youth A ate breakfast
of not on December 1, 2024.
Youth D and Youth F were interviewed separately via
telephone on December 4, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS
Worker who was at the facility. Youth D and Youth F reported
they could not recall if Youth A ate any meals on December 1,
2024.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
December 10, 2024. Staff 1 denied being aware of any meals
being withheld from Youth A on December 1, 2024
Staff 2 was interviewed via telephone on December 13, 2024,
in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 2 stated she believed
Youth A refused breakfast on December 1, 2024, but could not
recall if Youth A ate lunch or dinner that day.
Staff 3 was interviewed via telephone on December 20, 2024,
in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 3 reported Youth A
was provided lunch but choose not to eat the food because Youth
A did not like what was provided. Staff 3 reported she did not
know if Youth A ate dinner or not.
Staff 4 was interviewed via telephone on December 26, 2024,
in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 4 reported Youth A
did not have lunch or dinner on December 1, 2024. Staff 4
described Youth A being encouraged to eat and go with the group,
9

but Youth A refused to be with Youth B or Youth C. Staff 4 stated
she told Youth A staff would keep Youth B and Youth C separate
and away from Youth A so she could eat but Youth A still would
not eat.
Documents Reviewed:
• Client Refusal Form. Form lists Youth A refused
medication and breakfast on 12/01/24. Form is signed and
dated by staff.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as per Youth A and staff
interviews Youth A was offered meals throughout the day but
refused to eat what was provided.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code Health services; policies and procedures.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4142
Section (1) An institution shall establish and follow written health service
Description policies and procedures addressing all of the following:
(a) Routine and emergency medical, and dental, and behavioral
health care.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 12/01/24, a youth was assaulted by two other youth at the
facility. Youth sustained injuries and the staff refused the youth
medical attention. Youth punched out two windows to receive
medical attention. EMS assessed the youth and did not have
medical services to provide. The facility refused to transport the
youth to the hospital. Youth does not feel safe currently.
Investigation Complainant was interviewed via telephone on December 2,
2024, and reported no further information.
Youth A was interviewed via telephone on December 4, 2024,
in collaboration with DHHS Worker who was at the facility.
Youth A reported she “busted” windows with a rock and her right
hand. Youth A stated “EMR” (meant MMR, Mobile Medical
Response) arrived, and Supervisor told EMR there was nothing
wrong with Youth A, so Youth A did not leave the facility for
medical treatment. Youth A reported her lip was cut and staff kept
10

telling her to rinse her mouth so it would not get infected. Youth A
stated “EMR” also told her to rinse her mouth with water. Youth A
reported the morning after the fight Staff 8 called Great Lakes Bay
Health Center (referred to as HDI) and HDI told Staff 8 Youth A
did not need to be seen for medical treatment. Youth A stated the
person on the phone was “very rude.”
Youth B was interviewed via telephone on December 4, 2024,
in collaboration with DHHS Worker who was at the facility.
Youth B reported Youth A’s mouth was bleeding from the fight.
Youth B stated she was not aware if Youth A was sent out for
medical attention.
Youth C was interviewed via telephone on December 4, 2024,
in collaboration with DHHS Worker who was at the facility.
Youth C stated Staff 7 and Supervisor 2 checked on Youth A,
Youth B and Youth C to see if they needed medical attention.
Youth C reported Supervisor 2 called HDI but none of the youth
left the campus on 12/01/2024 for medical attention. Youth C
stated Youth A went to the hospital the next morning but was not
sure why Youth A went to the hospital. Youth C described Youth
A having a bloody lip after the fight but that was the only injury
Youth C observed.
Youth D was interviewed via telephone on December 4, 2024,
in collaboration with DHHS Worker who was at the facility.
Youth D denied seeing any injuries on Youth A after the fight.
Youth D reported Staff 8 called HDI sometime after the fight and
did not believe Youth A left for medical treatment. Youth D stated
she believes Youth A or Youth C was given Ibuprofen by staff.
Youth F was interviewed via telephone on December 4, 2024,
in collaboration with DHHS Worker who was at the facility.
Youth F described Youth A having a bloody lip after the fight.
Youth F stated Supervisor 2 called HDI after the fight and Youth A
went for medical attention the next morning.
Staff 7 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
December 10, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff
7 described Youth A having a “split lip” from the fight and in Staff
7’s opinion, Youth A should have been taken in for stitches. Staff
7 reported she is not aware why Youth A did not go get stitches.
Staff 7 reported Supervisor 2 should have called HDI to get a
recommendation on what to do for Youth A. Staff 7 denied
Supervisor 2 made any phone calls for Youth A or Youth A getting
medical treatment.
11

Supervisor 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
December 10, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker.
Supervisor 1 denied being on shift when the fight occurred on the
unit but was working when Youth A punched the windows.
Supervisor 1 described Youth A breaking one window with her fist
and another window with a rock. Supervisor 1 reported Mobile
Medical Response, MMR, responded for the incident with the
windows and advised they could not do anything. Supervisor 1
stated HDI was also contacted for a second opinion and the
facility was told to take Youth A into Med Express in the morning,
which staff did on 12/02/2024.
Staff 2 was interviewed via telephone on December 13, 2024,
in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 2 described Youth A
having a “busted lip” after the fight. Staff 2 reported Youth A went
to the hospital but could not recall if it was the day of the fight or
the day after the fight. Staff 2 stated Supervisor 2 contacted
medical right after the fight for Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C.
Staff 9 was interviewed via telephone on December 13, 2024,
in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 9 stated Youth A
reported her injuries to Supervisor 2 and Supervisor 2 called the
hotline. Staff 9 reported the hotline told Supervisor 2 to give
Youth A an ice pack and Tylenol. Staff 9 denied Youth A left
campus for medical treatment the day of the fight.
Staff 3 was interviewed on December 20, 2024, via telephone
in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 3 reported Youth A
had some minor scratches and reported her lip hurt after the fight.
Staff 3 stated Youth A refused medical attention.
Documents Reviewed:
• Vassar Police Case Report 240003762. Report indicates
Youth A stated she was jumped by Youth B and Youth C.
It was documented Youth A has a visible laceration on her
right hand due to punching the windows according to Youth
A, a laceration on Youth A’s bottom lip that Youth A
claimed was from the assault and a laceration on Youth A’s
left middle finger by the knuckle. The report documents the
officer ordered MMR to the scene, but MMR and staff
denied letting Youth A get any further treatment.
• MedExpress report for Youth A dated 12/2/24. Diagnoses
of Youth A listed as, abrasion to Youth A’s anterior aspect
of her right hand and left middle finger and small laceration
to the inner aspect of Youth A’s lower lip. Instructions to
12

rinse mouth four times a day, Motrin as needed for pain
and keep wounds clean and dry, use Band-Aid as needed.
• MMR Report for Youth A dated 12/01/24. Report indicates
MMR arrived at the facility saw Youth A with a “fat lip and
small cut on right pinky knuckle from breaking a glass.”
Report documents, “cleared with service not needed.”
• HDI call record from 12/01/2024 at 7:14am documenting
Supervisor 2 called to discuss Youth A getting into a
physical altercation. Advised to give patient Ibuprofen or
Tylenol for pain and call back with ay other concerns.
• Staff logbook note from 12/01/24. Note documents HDI
was called for Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C. PA stated
to use Tylenol and ice pack for pain and to follow up with
nurse Monday if not feeling better.
• DHHS Worker’s interview notes with Supervisor 2. I was
not able to be present for this interview and Supervisor 2
left on medical leave soon after DHHS Worker’s interview.
Supervisor 2 reported she called HDI for Youth A, Youth B,
and Youth C after the fight and was directed to give the
youths Motrin and ice. Supervisor 2 reported when she first
called HDI the HDI office was not open and called three
different times before talking with someone.
• DHHS Worker’s interview notes with Paramedic. DHHS
Worker spoke with Paramedic on 1/06/2024. “[Paramedic]
confirmed responding to WHS on 12/1/24 regarding [Youth
A]. She stated a staff member was on the phone with a lady
and the lady asked the staff if [Youth A] needed to go out.
She stated the staff member said she did not and looked at
her [Paramedic] and she advised she did not see anything
that she would need to go out for. [Paramedic] stated she
did not see any injuries where [Youth A] would need to go
to the hospital for stitches or anything. She stated [Youth A]
had a "fat lip" and a couple minor cuts to her hand. She
denied any concerns of staff being negligent by not having
[Youth A] taken out. She further denied any concerns of
abuse/neglect by staff while there.”
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as per staff interviews as well
as review of HDI, MMR and DHHS Worker’s interview notes with
Paramedic, Youth A was provided medical treatment.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
13

Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(iv) Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a youth's
background or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats,
ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.

Type
Allegation Staff called youth a bitch.
Investigation Youth B was interviewed via telephone on December 4, 2024,
in collaboration with DHHS Worker who was at the facility.
Youth B reported Staff 5 called Youth B a “bitch” and said, “if we
[Youth B and Staff 5] were in Saginaw she [Staff 5] would beat my
ass.” Youth B stated this is the first time she has ever heard Staff
5 say something like this to anyone. Youth B described Staff 6
telling Staff 5 to “chill out.”

Youth F was interviewed via telephone on December 4, 2024,
